summary: This bill, the President Jimmy Carter Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a posthumous Congressional Gold Medal to former President Jimmy Carter. The bill details Carter's life and accomplishments, including his presidency, Nobel Peace Prize, work with the Carter Center, and humanitarian efforts. It authorizes the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange the presentation, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to create the medal, and designates the Carter Center as the recipient. The bill also allows for the production and sale of bronze duplicates.
